reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We staye 1 night at Ichinoyu because I had to experience what a traditional ryokan was like seeing I was in Japan. I booked through their hotel website. They were very efficient in responding to my email and questions. The place is not far from the Hakone-Yumoto station, only ~20 minutes walk which we did after we checked out. However, we took the taxi to get there from the station because we had not idea where to go. By taxi, it costs 660 yen. We stayed in what they call the Type 2 room which had it's own hot spring bath with river view. It was very nice. We also booked the public batch which allowed the guests 30 minutes each time but this is not a long time becuase by the time you change and wash yourself before and after the bath, it only leaves you about 20-15 minutes. I'd recommended trying to get room with its own bath because that way, you have use of the hot spring as long as you want. Dinner was excellent! They feed you up really good. Breakfast is great but only if you like fish in the morning which was I was quite happy about. The staff is really friendly too. It was a great experience. We really enjoyed it.

reviews.text: The ichinoyu is an experience- it's very authentically japanese. the rooms are traditional (tatami mats, no beds or chairs in the main room, sliding doors, bath with a shower head and no tub ect.) but the bathroom itself is a western style toilet. this is important if you don't like the japanese squat toilets. we stayed in one of the more expensive rooms so we could have our own personal onsen (hot spring). it was fully worth the price. it was tiny- two rather small people couldn't sit side by side very comfortably- but a lot of fun and the scenery was gorgeous. the room itself included an awesome fridge/freezer which is important in august.
reviews.title: An experience!

reviews.text: there are private and public hours for those who don't mind public onsen. you can reserve the public for private use or just go with other people.
reviews.title: Would stay again!
Nice private outdoor bath available
reviews.text: the room itself was a bit shabby with water damage on the walls and the toilet room wasn't pretty but everything was perfectly clean. keep in mind that some of the rooms are over 300 years old. the staff there was really nice and helpful but didn't speak english that fluently.
